definition: confused/disorderly/incoherent
top (of the head)/apex/to fall forwards/inverted/to jolt
surname San
three/3
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
four/4

sentences.english: Jack began to buff and puff when asked awkward question.
sentences.chinese: 要是问到棘手的问题，杰克就开始颠三倒四地胡说。

sentences.english: The children gave a confused account of what had happened…
sentences.chinese: 孩子们把发生的事叙述得颠三倒四。

sentences.english: But Andrew continued to act strangely and had trouble finding the right words when speaking.
sentences.chinese: 但是安德鲁每天仍然举止怪异，讲话的时候颠三倒四。

definition: to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
to harp on/over and over/merely ring changes on a few terms
not to the point/wide of the mark/neither here nor there/irrelevant
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: stammering/stuttering/not speaking fluently
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
nonsense/ridiculous talk/hogwash
lit. a donkey's lips do not match a horse's mouth (idiom)/fig. beside the point/incongruous
pinyin: lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: amidst the clouds and mist/(fig.) mystified/puzzled
a bunch of nonsense/verbose and rambling
deranged/erratic
incoherent speech/to talk without rhyme or reason (idiom)
to talk nonsense (idiom)/frivolous talk
clumsy in speaking/awkward/inarticulate
to chatter/to babble
to lisp/unclear articulation/inarticulate
